content: a tail long enough to sew each leg to the 6 body later on tail row instruction stitches 1 chain 2 4 single_crochet in second chain from hook 4 2 single_crochet in each single_crochet around including the slip_stitch from the previous round 5 3 4 work even bind off leaving a tail long enough to sew the tail to the 5 body later on page 4 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com putting it all together finished frank frank s a really goofy looking work in progress this shot is about ½ way through the body to weigh down frank s back end i decided to use some saran wrap and some black beans they are hard to see against my dark countertops… page 5 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com i put about 2 tbsp s of black beans in a strip of saran wrap and wrapped it up then i crammed it into that opening when i still had 16 stitches going then put a little more polyfil inside him and sewed him up since the holes are so big on the bottom from decreasing so much in one row i ran my yarn through those stitches to help close it up a little bit you can tell which ones i ve already ran the yarn through don t pull too tight on the yarn though page 6 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com this is what frank s body looked like at this point compared to the inspiration next i put on the ears on the inspiration dog they are right next to each other so i did the same i set them back between the 10th and 11th row from the nose centered on the middle of the head which i determined by putting the seam on the bottom of frank but the hump for his hind quarters helps you determine that too the tail was next i left the tail flat and sewed in on at the back top as you can see page 7 of 8 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com since the legs are so tiny i use a pencil to stuff tiny bits of polyfil into them then i sewed each leg on and voila frank was done i sewed his eyes and mouth on using 2 plys of a 4 ply yarn that i separated you could also use embroidery thread his eyes are just lines and his mouth wraps around the bottom of his head in some of these pictures he s wearing a collar my son made you can just ignore that page 8 of 8
